newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Oracle soars.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Oracle soars.

text.p: Oracle Corp shares staged a powerful, earnings-driven rally preceding Friday's U.S. market open, rising to 40 from 36-1/8, traders said.
Last night, the leading maker of database management software reported fiscal third quarter earnings of $0.25 per share, including a $0.04 per share charge related to the acquisition of Datalogix.
The pre-charge results matched the Wall Street forecast compiled by Zack's Investment Research.
Revenues for the period ended February 28 climbed to $1.37 billion from $1.02 billion one year ago, Oracle said.
Moving in the opposite direction from Oracle were a pair of stocks that issued earning warnings, sparking an investor exodus.

First was Employee Solutions Inc, which traded as low as eight in early Friday third market activity from 15-3/8 at the Nasdaq close and below the 10 reached in last night's after-hours trading session.
The wipe-out added to Employee Solutions' 4-1/2 loss during regular trade Thursday.
This morning, the company said it expects fourth quarter earnings to be below analyst estimates.
According to Zack's, Employee Solutions was expected to earn $0.14 per share in the December quarter. The company earned $0.05 per share in the year-ago period.

The second loser was Premisys Communications Inc, which collapsed to 6-3/4 from 11-1/4 after announcing this morning it expects to lose $0.10 to $0.14 per share in the quarter ending March 31, including a previously announced $0.09 per share charge.

Other shares active before the open included Cisco Systems off 1/2 to 52. Philip Morris up two to 128, DSC Communications Corp, up 1-1/4 to 19-3/4, Intel, up one to 142-1/4 and Zitel Corp up to 40-3/4 from 37-1/2.
